intro: Strobilanthes larium, commonly known as the silver leaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
